Topic.Title: Vietmaneses are buying BAC like crazy !!!!

Message.Msg: My father was a Colonel in the South Vietnamese Police. I drank snake wine and ate dog pho with my uncles (all Colonels) in their villa in Saigon. The only thing they wanted to talk about was sending money over to their Vietnamese brothers (all Colonels) in Westminster, Ca to invest in dental clinics, strip malls, pho restaurants and BAC. I told them to forget everything but BAC and Greyhound Racing. They said Greyhound racing could eventually be fruitful to the Pho Restaurants. I agree. BAC taking off faster than Greyhound chasing Rabbit around the track. Eventually the Greyhound get tired and ends up in the boiler at Pho Restaurant. The point is: Sell BAC at higher price than you bought it for. Ancient Secret of the Tran Dynasty.

Message.Title: 2013 EOY Price Target
Message.Msg: I think we will easily be about $20 by year end. What do you all think? $5 billion buy back when done with will boost the price significantly. There are plenty of other reasons too as we all know.

Topic.Title: 2013 EOY Price Target

Message.Msg: Actually it is a 11 BILLION buyback. They also bought 5.5 Billion worth of Preferred in ADDITION to the 5.5 Billion Common. This will reduce interest payments on same by about 80 Million per year. This goes on the books as cash! I will be closer to 25.PPS by year end. Remember, now trading at about .60% of book. Been "held" down by hedgies manipulating PPS. GL.

Topic.Title: 2013 EOY Price Target

Message.Msg: My target is $16, but anything higher is even better. Brian did the absolute best thing to maximize long term shareholder value. By doing the $5.5 billion preferred stock buyback he is saving $450 million a year in interest expense, that will add a tremendous amount to the bottom line of net income. Also, the $5 billon common stock buyback is actually a huge bonus to the company. Remember the firm is selling for 60% of book value. That means, we are paying 60 cents for every $1 of assets. It is like saying we are buying $7 billion worth of stock ($5 billion plus 40% more which is $2 billion = $7 billion). What he has done is going to set BAC up for a great earnings run up for the 2nd quarter. Add to that, housing is quickly moving higher and higher and that means less foreclosures and more value for homes being sold, higher asset values on our balance sheet. We should hit $16 by Dec/2013. Lastly nice NOT to have a Stupid Political Post like ALL the losers keep posting.

Message.Title: Soon Upgrades and Higher Price Should Occur
Message.Msg: Why? The preferred stock buyback saves us $450 million a year, it means BAC is now much more profitable. Also, the common stock buyback will boost stock price higher too. Thus, the analysts have to re-calculate a higher Price Target for BAC.

Topic.Title: 2013 EOY Price Target

Message.Msg: Interest savings on preferred and reduced float will increase EPS by around 7-8%. So $15 looks more likely that $20. The cost cutting efforts would also add to margins. If they do more on cost savings, 2014 could be a real turn around year in terms of stock price and dividend increases. Buying now makes a lot of sense because economy improving, litigation cost will dissipate, losses from foreclosures disappearing, dividend increaes every year - all of these catalysts will take it to $20 and $25 in 2015. So 100% gain in two years is not a bad return.

Topic.Title: 2013 EOY Price Target

Message.Msg: Less not forget, Warren has 7% preferreds and those are probably next on the chopping block. That will save a small fortune too. No reason to believe that BAC cannot buy out Warren's preferred stock in late Summer. That will give a huge boost to cash flow generation every year. Buffett bought 50,000 preferred shares of Bank of America at a dividend of 6% a year, or $300 million dividend payment into Buffett’s pocket. Buffett also is receiving warrants that allow him to buy 700 million shares at a strike price of about $7.14 a share but those shares have always been calculated in the fully dilutted eps. That means, soon we could see $750 millon saving on dividend payments on the preferred stock. I definitely see $16 by Dec/2013, or higher.
